message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms and physical examination suggest dermatomyositis, which is associated with an increased risk of ovarian adenocarcinoma. The other options are not typically associated with dermatomyositis.
We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest dermatomyositis. Among the options, ovarian adenocarcinoma is most commonly associated with dermatomyositis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has dermatomyositis, which is associated with an increased risk of malignancy, especially ovarian adenocarcinoma. Pheochromocytoma is associated with hypertension and adrenal masses, which are not present in this case. The other options are not commonly associated with dermatomyositis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s clinical manifestations suggest the diagnosis of dermatomyositis. Among the options, ovarian adenocarcinoma is most commonly associated with dermatomyositis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The violaceous rash over the eyelids and flat-topped erythematous papules over the dorsal surface of interphalangeal joints are characteristic features of dermatomyositis, a type of inflammatory myopathy. Among the options, ovarian adenocarcinoma is significantly associated with dermatomyositis. Pheochromocytoma, Hodgkin lymphoma, and renal clear cell carcinoma are not known to be associated with inflammatory myopathies.
